Axcelerate eDiscovery | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | num_employees = 500 | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | owner = | company_slogan = | homepage = [http://www.recommind.com/ recommind.com] | dissolved = | footnotes = }} '''Recommind''' is a privately held [[San Francisco, CA|San Francisco]], [[California]]-based company that builds and sells software for [[electronic discovery]], [[information governance]], [[enterprise search]] and content categorization. == History == Recommind was founded in 2000 by [[Jan Puzicha]], [[Thomas Hofmann]] and [[Derek Schueren]]. [[Probabilistic latent semantic analysis]] (PLSA), a technique used for data analysis, is the underlying methodology for Recommind's software technology. Puzicha and Hofmann introduced and then patented PLSA in 1999, based on research they undertook at [[University of California, Berkeley]].{{Cite web |url= http://www.google.com/patents/US6687696|title= System and method for personalized search, information filtering, and for generating recommendations utilizing statistical latent class models|accessdate= 2013-4-10|date= 2013-4-10}} ==The company today== The company has been named as a leader in enterprise search by [[industry analyst]] firm [[Forrester Research]].{{cite web |url=http://www.forrester.com/rb/Research/wave%26trade;_enterprise_search,_q2_2008/q/id/43719/t/2 |title=The Forrester Wave&tm;: Enterprise Search, Q2 2008 |work=[[Forrester Research]] |date=2008-05-28 |accessdate=2013-04-10}} Recommind was selected as a leader in the 2013 [[Gartner]] Magic Quadrant for e-discovery.{{Cite web |url= http://www.law.com/jsp/lawtechnologynews/PubArticleLTN.jsp?id=1202606837544&Gartner_Announces_EDiscovery_Leaders_in_Magic_Quadrant&slreturn=20130601024552|title= Gartner Announces E-Discovery Leaders in 'Magic Quadrant'|accessdate= 2013-7-1|date= 2013-6-17}} In 2013, the company was selected as among the world's top 10 most innovative companies in [[big data]] by Fast Company.{{Cite web |url= http://www.fastcompany.com/most-innovative-companies/2013/industry/big-data|title= The world's top 10 most innovative companies in big data|accessdate= 2013-2-25|date= 2013-2-12}} In the same year, it secured an e-discovery review contract with the [[Securities and Exchange Commission]].{{Cite web |url= http://www.sfgate.com/default/article/Recommind-lands-SEC-as-software-client-4247554.php|title=
